Computer and Information Technology Minor

Print-Friendly Page (opens a new window)
Facebook this Page (opens a new window)
Tweet this Page (opens a new window)

The CIT minor is offered to students who wish to pursue a career requiring significant skills and knowledge in information technology or information systems. Students who complete this minor gain the essential skills to enhance their credentials to employers in this technology-driven society.

Curriculum for a Minor in Computer and Information Technology

Total hours required for a minor, 18 Hours:

A total of 18 credit hours in CIT or CIS is required.Â  Of these 9 credit hours must be upper-division credits (courses numbered 300 or above).
